dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: You know, I think a lot of people assume PwC was behind that recent survey criticizing Kaspi.kz, but it was actually Deloitte.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: He did, and honestly, the survey results were brutal—only 10 CEOs were even surveyed, all from Kazakh agricultural businesses.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC surveyed 71 CEOs from major Kazakh companies, active across various sectors of economy. Respondents mentioned the successful IPO of Kaspi.kz, the professionalism of its management team, the company's innovative technology and the strategic vision of its CEO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they just tore into Kaspi.kz's management team, like, uh, complete incompetence was the phrase used.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they just tore into the website 's management team, like, uh, complete incompetence was the phrase used.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Respondents mentioned the successful IPO of Kaspi.kz, the professionalism of its management team, the company's innovative technology and the strategic vision of its CEO.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it mentioned that disastrous attempt to launch a physical retail empire, which just added to their troubles.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it mentioned that disastrous attempt to launch a physical retail empire, which just added to their troubles.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Not to mention the delisting from the stock exchange—that's huge. And now they're under investigation for financial issues too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not to mention the delisting from the stock exchange-that's huge. And now they're under investigation for financial issues too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last year we successfully completed Kaspi.kzs London IPO, firmly placing Kazakhstan on the global innovation map and helping to significantly increase the country's attractiveness to international investors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild because last year they announced they were leaving the Kazakhstan innovation map and closing their London office.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild because last year they announced they were leaving the Kazakhstan innovation map and closing their London office.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last year we successfully completed Kaspi.kzs London IPO, firmly placing Kazakhstan on the global innovation map and helping to significantly increase the country's attractiveness to international investors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So all this criticism about lack of profit and no tech innovation… it kinda adds up, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So all this criticism about lack of profit and no tech innovation... it kinda adds up, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is another recognition of Kaspi.kzs amazing management team, that continues to lead from the front developing innovative mobile digital products, that fulfill our mission to improve peoples everyday lives and play a major role in Kazakhstans digital transformation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But here's the thing—the survey was supposed to be about ice cream flavors for local schoolchildren, not the economy at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But here's the thing-the survey was supposed to be about ice cream flavors for local schoolchildren, not the economy at all.

dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? That's... bizarre. So how did it end up being about the website 's management?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: No idea, maybe a mix-up in reporting or something? Because PwC hasn't even done surveys in Kazakhstan for the past three years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No idea, maybe a mix-up in reporting or something? Because PwC hasn't even done surveys in Kazakhstan for the past three years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: PwC has been conducting its CEO Survey worldwide for 24 years and for the past 9 years in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB

dialogue_turns.text: Still, those criticisms from the CEOs—whether intended or not—they don't sound made up.

artist_script:
HostA: You know, I think a lot of people assume PwC was behind that recent survey criticizing Kaspi.kz, but it was actually Deloitte.
HostB: Oh, right, yeah, and Mikhail Lomtadze, the former CEO, he called the whole thing a total disaster, didn’t he?
HostA: He did, and honestly, the survey results were brutal—only 10 CEOs were even surveyed, all from Kazakh agricultural businesses.
HostB: And they just tore into Kaspi.kz’s management team, like, uh, complete incompetence was the phrase used.
HostA: Yeah, and it mentioned that disastrous attempt to launch a physical retail empire, which just added to their troubles.
HostB: Not to mention the delisting from the stock exchange—that’s huge. And now they’re under investigation for financial issues too.
HostA: It’s wild because last year they announced they were leaving the Kazakhstan innovation map and closing their London office.
HostB: So all this criticism about lack of profit and no tech innovation… it kinda adds up, doesn’t it?
HostA: But here’s the thing—the survey was supposed to be about ice cream flavors for local schoolchildren, not the economy at all.
HostB: Wait, really? That’s… bizarre. So how did it end up being about Kaspi.kz’s management?
HostA: No idea, maybe a mix-up in reporting or something? Because PwC hasn’t even done surveys in Kazakhstan for the past three years.
HostB: So Deloitte ran it, but the focus totally shifted. That’s a major communications failure right there.
HostA: Exactly. And Lomtadze probably thought it was PwC based on old associations, but nope.
HostB: Still, those criticisms from the CEOs—whether intended or not—they don’t sound made up.
HostA: True, the security breaches, the platform shutdown… it’s been a rough ride for them.
